articles.author: Fenit Nirappil
articles.title: Coronavirus vaccines, once free, are now pricey for uninsured people - The Washington Post
articles.description: The elimination of the Bridge Access Program means some low-income Americans must pay up to $200 for an updated shot.
articles.content:
As updated coronavirus vaccines hit U.S. pharmacy shelves, adults without health insurance are discovering the shots are no longer free, instead costing up to $200.
The federal Bridge Access Program… [+9063 chars]
